9: * The purpose of this utility is to identify tables with outdated statistics involved in a query
10: * It accepts an input query file of the form: EXPLAIN VERBOSE query
11: * It will execute the input file and scan explain verbose plan of the query to identify the tables scanned
12: * It will execute a query to check count of records on the identified table and compare it with the reltuples
14: * If the difference between record cound and reltuples is withing a defined percentage, stats are considered t
15: o be up-to-date else are marked as outdated.
16: * It will also capture explain plan for the query in log file under current working directory
17: * Example to run the utility: ./gp_stats_check -f query1.sql
20: -h, --help            show this help message and exit

28: Optional, define port for master database process, by
31: Optional, define name of the database against which
32: query must be executed, by default gpadmin
